alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:30AM EST until January 30 at 2:01AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Johnson, Wilkinson and Washington Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17 feet, Flood stage is reached. The water level reaches the top of the Old Balls Ferry Road boat ramp...just upstream and rightbank from the Georgia Highway 57 bridge. Minor flooding of woodlands near the river occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EST Sunday the stage was 14.9 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 17.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 17 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
